gems.description: Finds the shortest unique abbreviation amongst many strings

Encodes and decodes strings to a [Base64](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Base64) representation. Implemented as a small wrapper around [String#unpack](https://idiosyncratic-ruby.com/4-what-the-pack.html)
Benchmark utility: Measures and reports the time used to execute code
Support for arbitrary-precision floating point decimal arithmetic
[Bundler](https://bundler.io) is the local package manager for Ruby applications

gems.notes: Only the escape utilities are implemented as native extension.

gems.description: Trigonometric and transcendental functions for complex numbers

gems.notes: Replaced by a new debugger library with the same name

gems.description: Provides three ways to [delegate](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Delegation_pattern) method calls
Patches error messages to suggest correct spelling of methods/classes/variables
Provides common [hash functions](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Hash_function) like MD5, SHA1, SHA2, or RIPEMD-160
Improves error messages with additional debug info

Loads values from the OS' `fcntl.h` to be used for low-level [file descriptor manipulation](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/File_descriptor) system calls with [IO#fcntl](https://ruby-doc.org/core/IO.html#method-i-fcntl) and [IO.sysopen](https://ruby-doc.org/core/IO.html#method-c-sysopen)
Utilities for working with the file system, such as copying, moving, or deleting files
Finds all files in a given directory and its sub-directories
gems.notes: You can get a very similar result using: ```find .`.split($/)``

gems.description: Provides a way to [delegate](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Delegation_pattern) method calls. Also see [this overview of delegation in Ruby](http://radar.oreilly.com/2014/02/delegation-patterns-in-ruby.html), which contains an example
Patches `IO` for simple and portable access to the console
gems.notes: There is also the old [GitHub repo](https://github.com/nobu/io-console), but it is out of sync.

gems.description: Allows to work with `IO` streams in a non-blocking way
Adds methods to wait until an `IO` stream becomes readable or writable

gems.notes: - Latest Ruby releases for 2.4 / 2.5 / 2.6 / 2.7 contain a security fix (CVE-2020-16255) not included in the listed gem versions

- **Attention:** There was a 1.2.8 version on rubygems, which was later [yanked](https://rubygems.org/gems/logger/versions/1.2.8)
- The old repository is at [github.com/nahi/logger](https://github.com/nahi/logger)

gems.description: A mixin that makes any object behave like a [mutex](https://ruby-doc.org/core/Mutex.html)
Internal class for the other net-* libraries
[Kanji](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Kanji) encoding converter. Can also be used via the [Kconv.kconv method](https://github.com/ruby/nkf/blob/master/lib/kconv.rb).
Implementation of the [observer pattern](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Observer_pattern), a way to let interested other objects know o an objetc's updates
Monkeypatches [Kernel#open](https://ruby-doc.org/core/Kernel.html#method-i-open) to support remote endpoints via `net/http` and `net/ftp`
Wrapper around [Hash](https://ruby-doc.org/core/Hash.html) which lets you read and set attributes with a method-based API
Wraps `File`, `FileTest`, `Dir`, and `FileUtils` to ease working with file system paths
The `pp` print debugging helper via `require 'pp'`. It will format the result object in more readable way.
Better object formatting and inspection. Also see the [pp gem](/pp/).
Access to prime numbers and prime factorization
Transactional file storage for Ruby objects
If available, [readline-ext](https://stdgems.org/readline-ext) will be loaded, or (Ruby-only) [reline](https://stdgems.org/reline) will be used.
Support fot the [Linda distributed computing paradigm](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Linda_%28coordination_language%29) in [drb](https://ruby-doc.org/stdlib/libdoc/drb/rdoc/index.html)
A shim gemspec to indicate that the Ruby implementation includes the `ruby2_keywords` method
gems.notes: Although `ruby2_keywords` is introduced as a default gem in Ruby 3.1, the `ruby2_keywords` method is available on earlier Ruby versions. See [the announcement](https://www.ruby-lang.org/en/news/2019/12/12/separation-of-positional-and-keyword-arguments-in-ruby-3-0/) and [this blog post](https://eregon.me/blog/2021/02/13/correct-delegation-in-ruby-2-27-3.html) for information about how to use this feature.

gems.description: [RubyGems](https://rubygems.org) allows you to download, install, and use Ruby software packages on your system
Provides crpytographical randomness from openssl or the OS
Data structure for unordered collections without duplicates. Implemented on top of Hash. Also comes with `SortedSet` for ordered collections.
Provides a Ruby interface for interacting with the [shell](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bourne_shell)
Escape and manipulate commads to be run in the [shell](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bourne_shell)
Mixin for Ruby classes that should only have one instance
Makes strings behave like IO objects
[Two-phase lock](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Two-phase_locking) with a counter for multi-threaded code
Simplifies OS independent creation of temporary files
Auto-terminates code blocks after the time limit is reached
Adds a `Dir.mktmpdir` method for creating temporary directories OS independently

Topological sorting using [Tarjan’s algorithm](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Tarjan%27s_strongly_connected_components_algorithm), which finds [strongly connected components](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Strongly_connected_component) in [graphs](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Graph_%28abstract_data_type%29)
Explicitely allow objects to be garbage collected

gems.notes: **Please note:** Despite the gemspec stating otherwise, the webrick version included with Ruby might be more recent than version 1.4.2. For example, the webrick included in Ruby 2.6.5, 2.5.7, 2.4.9, and 2.4.8 does include security fixes for CVE-2019-16201 and CVE-2019-16254.

gems.description: `require 'yaml'` will load the [psych default gem](https://stdgems.org/psych/), **yaml/dbm** is a wrapper around [DBM](https://stdgems.org/dbm/) using YAML serialization, and **yaml/store** lets you use [pstore](https://stdgems.org/pstore/) with YAML
